content.title: Intro
content.content:
1913
Preceded by
1913
1914
Year
1915
Followed by
1915

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1914.

content.title: Early
content.content: ? - Edith Bratt converts to Catholicism and becomes engaged to J.R.R. Tolkien.

content.title: January
content.content:
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien begins working on The Book of Ishness.
10 - Scholar Angus McIntosh, pupil and friend of J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
30 - The Chequers Clubbe, founded by J.R.R. Tolkien, is given permission to organize dinners.
? - Rules of the Exeter College Essay Club, signed by J.R.R. Tolkien, is printed.

content.title: February
content.content: 14 - Translator Britt G. Hallqvist is born.

content.title: June
content.content:
1 - George Sayer, friend of J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
18 - The Chequers Clubbe, founded by J.R.R. Tolkien, meet to have dinner.

content.title: August
content.content:
4 - The British Empire declares war on Germany, following tension and conflict on the mainland in July. George Allen & Unwin's offices are opened in London by Stanley Unwin.
9 - Artist Tove Jansson is born.
? - Hilary Tolkien joins the army as a bugler.
? - Geoffrey Bache Smith and Robert Gilson join the army. Christopher Wiseman joins the navy instead.

content.title: September
content.content:
16 - Author and librarian William Ready is born.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes The Voyage of Eärendel the Evening Star.

content.title: October
content.content:
1 - Donald A. Wollheim is born.
? - Tolkien, still undergraduate, is training at the Officer's Training Corps. He writes Letter 1 to his fiancée Edith Bratt.

content.title: December
content.content:
22 - Tolkien writes Ferrum et Sanguis: 1914.
25 - The T.C.B.S. meet in London.

Spring - J.R.R. Tolkien is awarded the Skeat Prize for English by the Exeter College. He spends the £5 prize money on buying four books.
? - Artist Horus Engels is born.
Years
1911 1912 1913 1914 1915 1916 1917
